byline.contributor: Alain Delaquérière contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Fifteen residents of St Louis region file two suits against suburbs of Ferguson and Jennings that challenge constitutionality of what they say is rampant ticketing and jailing from tickets going unpaid; suits both seek class-action status, and allege system of ticketing is designed to pad cities' coffers and disproportionately affects blacks and the poor.
lead_paragraph: Plaintiffs from the St. Louis region accused Ferguson and Jennings of creating modern-day debtors’ prisons in a quest for more revenue.

headline.main: Ferguson One of 2 Missouri Suburbs Sued Over Gantlet of Traffic Fines and Jail
